channel.title: CyberNetSec - Security Operations
channel.description: Latest security operations threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: 'Skeleton Key' Attacks Bypass Defenses by Weaponizing Legitimate RMM Tools
item.description:
A sophisticated attack campaign dubbed "Skeleton Key" is bypassing traditional, malware-focused security defenses by weaponizing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. A report from KnowBe4 Threat Labs details how attackers first compromise user credentials and then abuse truste...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Security Operations, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact
item.description:
A new survey by specialty insurer AXIS Capital, released on January 20, 2026, reveals a significant perception gap between CEOs and CISOs regarding the role of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity. While CEOs are largely optimistic about AI's productivity and security benefits, CISOs are more ac...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: NSA Kickstarts Zero Trust Adoption with New Foundational Implementation Guides
item.description:
The U.S. National Security Agency (NSA) has released the first two documents in its new Zero Trust Implementation Guidelines (ZIGs) series. The 'Primer' and 'Discovery Phase' guides are designed to provide federal agencies and other organizations with a foundational roadmap for adopting a Zero Trust...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: ColorTokens Xshield Platform Gains FedRAMP Moderate Authorization, Boosting Federal Zero Trust Adoption
item.description:
ColorTokens has achieved FedRAMP Moderate Authorization for its Xshield microsegmentation platform, a significant milestone that makes the solution readily available to U.S. federal agencies via the FedRAMP Marketplace. This authorization validates Xshield's security posture and enables government b...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security, Security Operations

item.title: Asimily Boosts Cisco ISE Integration with Enhanced Microsegmentation for IoT/OT Devices
item.description:
Asimily, a provider of cyber asset and exposure management, has launched enhanced microsegmentation capabilities, including new support for Security Group Access Control Lists (SGACL) in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE). item.title: SpyCloud Unveils Supply Chain Threat Protection to Combat Third-Party Identity Risks
item.description:
SpyCloud has launched its Supply Chain Threat Protection solution, a new platform designed to give organizations visibility into identity-related compromises within their vendor and supplier ecosystems. By leveraging a massive repository of recaptured data from breaches and malware infections, the s...

item.title: Noction IRP v4.3 Launches with Automated DDoS Detection and Routing-Native Mitigation
item.description:
Noction has released version 4.3 of its Intelligent Routing Platform (IRP), introducing a major new feature called Automatic Anomaly Detection (AAD). This capability uses behavior-based traffic analysis to rapidly identify DDoS attacks and other network anomalies. Once an attack is detected, the pla...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cyberattack, Security Operations, Patch Management

item.title: JumpCloud Unveils AI-Powered Tools to Govern Shadow AI and Manage Autonomous Agents
item.description:
JumpCloud has introduced a suite of AI-powered capabilities for its identity and access management (IAM) platform, designed to help organizations manage the security risks of modern AI adoption. The new features focus on discovering and governing 'shadow AI'—the unsanctioned use of AI tools by emplo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security, Security Operations

item.title: Palo Alto Networks Patches High-Severity DoS Flaw in PAN-OS Firewalls
item.description:
Palo Alto Networks has issued security updates to address a high-severity denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability, CVE-2026-0227, in its PAN-OS software. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.7, allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to crash firewalls that have a GlobalProtect gateway or portal e...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: High-Severity Flaw in Mailpit Dev Tool Allows Email Interception
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-22689, has been discovered in Mailpit, a popular email testing tool for developers. The flaw is a Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking (CSWSH) issue affecting all versions prior to 1.28.2. It allows a remote attacker to intercept sensitive data, including...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →
